Photo#525136Copyright © 2011 Emile

Bright yellow & black Wasp with ornate patterning - Philanthus

Madrona Marsh Preserve, Torrance, Los Angeles County, California, USA

June 3, 2011

Size: ~ 7 mm

This pretty wasp was nervously nectaring on Seaside heliotrope (Heliotropium curassavicum).

It was much in a hurry and I didn't get any decent photos; only this blurry in-flight image.

It looks a lot like a Beewolf.

Would this be Philanthus multimaculatus ?

P. multimaculatus is the only Beewolf recorded from the Preserve so far, but this specimen's patterning is quite different ...

Feel free to frass afterward.
